pr_title: [BEAM-10669] Add support for Dataflow Templates in SnowflakeIO

timeline.message: [BEAM-10669] Changed SnowflakeIO parameters to ValueProvider<> and moved most of functionalities to expand methods
[BEAM-10669] Changed quotation mark to value provider variable
[BEAM-10669] Excluded test key in Snowflake resources in RAT task
[BEAM-10669] fixed dependencies in Snowflake streaming IOIT test

timeline.author: pabloem
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -390,6 +407,12 @@
      * @return
      */
     public Read<T> withQuotationMark(String quotationMark) {
+      return toBuilder()
+          .setStorageIntegrationName(ValueProvider.StaticValueProvider.of(quotationMark))

timeline.bodyText: In this case, the key comes from a file path in the local machine at pipeline construction time. Is that right?
timeline.author: pabloem

timeline.bodyText:
These data are sensitive, so maybe we should not show them so readily. They are part of the create job request, and also visible in the UI (by anyone who has access to the job, including support engineers). (to be fair, PipelineOptions are also visible in the UI) - are you sure it makes sense to make them display data?
I don't have strong opinions either way, but I think it makes sense to reflect what's the best approach.
timeline.author: pabloem

replies.bodyText:
It make sense to hide those options.
I tried to hide those options but without success. Do you have any tips how to accomplish this ?
replies.author: purbanow

replies.bodyText: The only way to 'hide' them would be to remove them from display data. It's up to you if you'd like to keep it in DD or remove it.
replies.author: pabloem

replies.bodyText: up to you. I am happy to merge as-is, or remove.
replies.author: pabloem

replies.bodyText: Let's merge it for now and see the feedback from users.
replies.author: purbanow

timeline.bodyText:
populateDisplayData is called at pipeline construction time. Since you're adding support for ValueProviders, you're enabling users to fill in the data for their credentials AFTER construction time. Imagine you're building a template. In that case, none of the credentials will be known.
Therefore, I think you likely don't want to throw this exception.
timeline.author: pabloem

replies.bodyText:
Before using provided credentials we're checking them using isNotEmpty method.
We tested it with dataflow templates by providing credentials from Dataflow UI.
replies.author: purbanow

timeline.bodyText:
I see you're using this method at pipeline construction time. Note that for RuntimeValueProviders, they will throw an exception when you ccall get on them at construction time.
The documentation is poor, but it'll throw IllegalStateException - so you also need to call valueProvider.isAccessible() before calling get on it. - and if it's not yet accessible, then that does not mean it's empty or not. It just means that we'll know later whether it's empty.
VP javadoc: https://beam.apache.org/releases/javadoc/2.23.0/org/apache/beam/sdk/options/ValueProvider.html
I hope I did not confuse you more here : )
timeline.author: pabloem

replies.bodyText:
No, it will not throw any exception. We tested it as simple jobs and as templates.
JAVA syntax is working in the way that valueProvider.get() != null is never going to be call if valueProvider != null  returns false  + all options inside SnowflakePipelineOptionshave default value or required annotation.
In terms of using valueProvider.isAccessible(), I tried to use it but it didn't work as I wanted. Assuming user is going to pass username variable  as null, then valueProvider.isAccessible() is going to return true but calling valueProvider.get().isEmpty() will result in NullPointException  as valueProvider.get() is  returning null.
replies.author: purbanow

replies.bodyText: okay, if you've tested this, then it LGTM.
replies.author: pabloem

timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/apache/beam into support-templates-in-snowflakeio
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/apache/beam into support-templates-in-snowflakeio
